title: For Sale:  2007 Audi A4 for sale
location: Rhode Island, Rhode Island, United States
postcontent:
Vehicle Description
...CARMART CERTIFIED...CARFAX 1- OWNER FL SEDAN...QUALITY PLUS CERTIFIED WARRANTY...FORMERLY AUDI CPO VEHICLE...GREAT FUEL ECONOMY...NON SMOKER...POWER ALL...SUNROOF...LEATHER...HEATED SEATS...ALLOY WHEELS...OUTSTANDING CONDITION...4 TO CHOOSE FROM...SERVICED AND INSPECTED...

The Audi A4 is one of the better cars in a crowd of smaller sport-luxury sedans that, dollar-for-dollar, offers some of the best, most appealing vehicles in the world.

The A4 line is complex, with 21 variants. The key is thinking according to priorities: body style, engine size, front wheel drive, transmission type. All are nicely balanced, enjoyable automobiles.

The A4 2.0T turbocharged, 200-hp four-cylinder is one of the better small engines going, with satisfying response and spry acceleration, particularly with the standard six-speed automatic transmission. It corners like a sports sedan, and high-quality construction is evident inside and out.
Every A4 should appeal to techies. State-of-the-art engines feature direct fuel injection: the cleanest, most efficient means yet devised to blend gasoline and air in an engine's cylinders. The 6-speed automatic transmission delivers truly seamless shifting. Sophisticated suspension technology is augmented with electronic stability control, which can help the driver avoid a crash. The A4 is stuffed with safety features and offers rear side-impact airbags, while most cars in its class don't.

Unlike other tech-heavy cars, the gizmos blend nicely in the A4, enhancing comfort, convenience and safety, and improving the driving experience.

The A4 can be pricey and it's relatively small. On the other hand, you'll have to look long and hard to find a car that blends driving satisfaction, safety, convenience, practicality, great finish and reasonable ownership cost as well as the A4.



Vehicle Options
4 Door, 2 Wheel Drive, Automatic w/overdrive Transmission, Turbo, Alloy Wheels, Fog lamps, New Tires, Sun/Moon Roof, Air Conditioning, Cruise Control, Heated Seats, Leather Seats, Power Door Locks, Power Mirrors, Power Seats, Power Steering, Power Windows, Rear Defrost, Tilt Steering, Tinted Windows, Alarm, AM/FM Radio, CD Player, Daytime Running Lights, Information Center, Keyless Entry, Steering Wheel Controls, Tire Pressure Monitoring System, Trip/Mileage Computer, Antilock Brakes, Driver Air Bag, Passenger Air Bag, Side Air Bags, Traction Control

title: For Sale/Trade:  JLD Enterprises marked PTR-91
postcontent:
PTR-91 with original JLD Enterprises markings.  Low “A” serial number, A27XX.  This is the original model before the company became PTR-91 Industries and is considered the best of the series.  Some original H&K parts built in. .308/7.62x51mm chambering.  Standard stock and HK sights.  No trunion issues.  Has both slim hand guard and a replacement UTG tri rail style. After market UTG claw scope mount (no scope) with 1913 style rail base.  Has no more than 200 rounds (all LC or Hornady brass) down the barrel.  Minor wear on upper receiver from claw mount, otherwise in like new condition.  40 twenty round magazines and 1 five round magazine.  Mags may have some wear, but are functional (I cleaned, loaded each to full capacity and checked the springs) and/or like new.

Asking $1200 for everything.  Prefer cash, but will consider serious (see below) trade offers.

The A4 line is complex, with 21 variants. The key is thinking according to priorities: body style, engine size, front wheel drive, transmission type. All are nicely balanced, enjoyable automobiles.

The A4 2.0T turbocharged, 200-hp four-cylinder is one of the better small engines going, with satisfying response and spry acceleration, particularly with the standard six-speed automatic transmission. It corners like a sports sedan, and high-quality construction is evident inside and out.
Every A4 should appeal to techies. State-of-the-art engines feature direct fuel injection: the cleanest, most efficient means yet devised to blend gasoline and air in an engine's cylinders. The 6-speed automatic transmission delivers truly seamless shifting. Sophisticated suspension technology is augmented with electronic stability control, which can help the driver avoid a crash. The A4 is stuffed with safety features and offers rear side-impact airbags, while most cars in its class don't.

Unlike other tech-heavy cars, the gizmos blend nicely in the A4, enhancing comfort, convenience and safety, and improving the driving experience.

The A4 can be pricey and it's relatively small. On the other hand, you'll have to look long and hard to find a car that blends driving satisfaction, safety, convenience, practicality, great finish and reasonable ownership cost as well as the A4.



Vehicle Options
4 Door, 2 Wheel Drive, Automatic w/overdrive Transmission, Turbo, Alloy Wheels, Fog lamps, New Tires, Sun/Moon Roof, Air Conditioning, Cruise Control, Heated Seats, Leather Seats, Power Door Locks, Power Mirrors, Power Seats, Power Steering, Power Windows, Rear Defrost, Tilt Steering, Tinted Windows, Alarm, AM/FM Radio, CD Player, Daytime Running Lights, Information Center, Keyless Entry, Steering Wheel Controls, Tire Pressure Monitoring System, Trip/Mileage Computer, Antilock Brakes, Driver Air Bag, Passenger Air Bag, Side Air Bags, Traction Control

I do my best to describe the item as well as I can. If you know something is wrong then trust yourself. I assume anyone looking at this item already knows more about it than I do. Thank you!

 USED - This item is sold as-is used. The vest shows absolutely no signs of wear (I'd rate it a 9.9 of 10). The plates show slight wear (I'd rate them a 9 of 10)

Releasable Armor Carrier TTRAC Coyote Brown
Part Number: 22004-14
Retail: $307.75 (without armor plates)
Manufacturers Description:
Tactical Tailor is proud to introduce the Tactical Tailor Releasable Armor Carrier (TTRAC). Manufactured from 1000 denier Cordura Nylon, the TTRAC will accommodate SAPI plates up to size XL (11"x14") as well as spall armor. The adjustable cummerbund has separate integrated pockets designed for military issue side SAPI plates (6"x7"). A center pull release system allows the wearer to easily release the vest using either hand and we have engineered it to be almost as easy to reassemble as it is to release. PLEASE NOTE: The TTRAC is designed to carry hard plates. It is not designed to hold BALCS style soft armor. The TTRAC features modular webbing on most of its surface which provides the user with nearly unlimited options for placement of MOLLE/PALS style equipment to meet almost any mission requirement and is fully adjustable to fit most wearers. Also features a reinforced drag handle.


The armor plates are size LARGE and have "7.62 mm APM2 Protection U.S." printed on the inside & "Size Large Strike Face Handle With Care" printed on the outside. (see pictures)

title: Want To Buy:  Looking for .38 With Shrouded Hammer Or Similar For My Mom!
postcontent:
My mom's ready to get herself a self protection firearm, and is trying to keep the outlay minimal. If I wasn't on the mediocre disability income I'm dependent upon, I'd buy her a nice light S&W snubbie, but in these circumstances I'm hoping that someone with a gun like the Taurus 85/Protector series will be willing to part with it for under $300 or so. I've cautioned my mom that this isn't an area to skimp so there's a bit of wiggle room.

At her age and reduced use and strength of her hands, I think something in the sub-17oz. weight, shooting standard .38 special (I don't think she'd do well with .38 +P much less .357 magnum loads), either JHP or Glasers, with a shrouded or even bobbed hammer to avoid snags will fill the bill.

Like me, she can't manipulate a semiauto's slide so it's definitely a revolver I'm looking for.

I hope we get this issue resolved soon, I don't like the idea of her going unarmed these days. If I weren't disabled and wheelchair bound I'd be happy to go with her when she goes out but right now that's just not going to happen.

title: For Sale:  M1842 US HARPERS FERRY 69 CALIBER MUSKET
postcontent:
Percussion smooth bore musket, all in military configuration, but the stock was shortened to the first barrel band and the barrel shortened to 38", from 42". This was most likely done at an arsenal in the late 1800s. Well marked lock reads; HARPERS FERRY 1845, with and eagle and a small US. Barrel marked VP, butt plate marked US. Fully functional, working crisp and tight. Fine walnut stock is sound, overall length 53". 

An opportunity to restore one of these rare guns, of the Civil War, from a very historical arsenal which is a tourist attraction today. Harper's Ferry was fought over and taken by both sides many times. Before that, John Brown captured it to ignite the Civil War and free the slaves...which he accomplished at the cost of his life and reputation. Patriot, or zealot? We can use a man like that again...to free us all, I think. Nice smooth patina on all metal surfaces, sound walnut stock, good original nipple, all original, ship weight is 12 pounds.






Asking $400 cash or $475 in trade

Smith & Wesson M&P 15 5.56/223

Features 16-inch barrel with chrome lined bores, chambers, bolt carriers, and gas keys. The chamber specification is 5.56mm NATO dimension or 223 Remington, and the rifling twist is 1:9. The flash suppressor is the A2 military style. The upper and lower receivers are fabricated from 7075 T6 aluminum, manufactured in the U.S. by an independent contractor to Smith & Wesson's specifications. title: For Sale:  AK For Sale! Hungarian AMD-65 Nodak Spud Receiver
postcontent:
Don't be afraid to make any offers.

This is a Hungarian AMD 65 AK. It works amazing, and is incredibly accurate for an AK. I hit all around the bull's eye at 100 yards with this thing while standing, no problem.

Its now painted flat black, so it looks even better and cooler than it does in the video and check out the pictures.

This AK is much better than those Century AK's and is more like an Arsenal, its probably somewhere right between as far as accuracy, quality, and sites. The sites are incredibly straight, and it will dance around the bull's eye all day long at 100 yards.

NOTES: US made barrel, Nodak Spud receiver, Tapco G2 trigger set, Tapco gas piston.

Just watch the video and you'll see for yourself: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=omnBGD59Ww0

Also, you'll see us goofin' off and shooting my M4 and R700 as well, in the primary, all day long, slaying bodies. Good to go?

Enjoy the video, and I hope you like what you see with the AK, its a bad little side folder, which also works great for HOME Defense, as its perfect for clearing your home. I knew of someone who killed an armed robbery and intruder in his house with one very similar to this, and he said the side folder really helped him clear his home, and also the firepower stopping power of the AK and its 30 round mag.

I really hate to sell this, as I love it so much, but I just really need the money right now.

Price is negotiable, throw offers out there, and we can discuss what to do about FTF transfer, if out of state (I'm in Georgia), and I'll ship to your FFL, and we can work out who pays shipping depending on what you're offering to pay.

I'll work with you. Gotta take care of ya'll.

Also, if you know anybody that is looking for an AK, or just loves buying tons of guns, send the link to them, and let them watch the video and see the pictures.

I appreciate your help if you help me sell this rifle soon, because I need the money.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Ranger Model 30 (Stevens 520) 12 ga shotgun
location: Clear Lake, MN, Minnesota, United States
postcontent:
I have a Ranger Model 30 12 gauge shotgun for sale.  From what I'm able to piece together, this gun is the same as a Stevens Model 520 but was renamed "Ranger" to sell in Sears Roebuck stores.  (Please note that I'm not a firearms historian though, so if the details are important to you, I can give you all the details and markings on the gun and you can verify this is correct).  I'm unsure of the age of the gun.  From information on the internet, I believe it was built somewhere between 1930 and 1940, but I haven't been able to verify that either.  

This gun was given to me by my uncle.  I really don't have a use for it.  I thought about cutting down the barrel to make it a home defense gun, but I couldn't do it to something this old.  The machining is beautiful and not like most firearms made today.  

I am unsure of the choke on the barrel, but the barrel length is 28".  I can measure the bore on the muzzle if anyone would like.  

It shoots well.  I haven't hunted with it, but shot trap a couple times and it functioned well.
